description.plain:
DJ and Brazilian music producer of electronic music, Alok Achkar Peres Petrillo (pronounced /ˈalˈɔk/) is one of the most famous brazilian DJ’s/Artist. His parents were the precursors of psy trance in the country, creating one of the country’s most famous festivals, Universo Paralelo. He accompanied his parents' performances alongside his twin brother Bhaskar. With it, the duo released a totally authorial album by the independent label Vagalume Records and Liquid Records arriving to do shows in about 19 countries, in addition to their songs being featured in the Beatport virtual store.

In 2010, he decided to pursue a solo career, changing from genre to house music, which he calls Brazilian bass. Alok released some songs, becoming prominent in the market, being requested in several national and international festivals. After signing a contract with Dutch label Spinnin' Records, he released the song “Hear Me Now” featuring Bruno Martini with vocals and composition by Marcos Zeeba. The song achieved in just one month 10 million views on YouTube and consecrated Alok as the first Brazilian artist to get 100 million plays on the streaming platform Spotify and to reach the top 50 most played songs in the service. It was also certified as a platinum record in Italy by the Federazione Industria Musicale Italiana (FIMI), in addition to entering musical charts in several countries.

Petrillo eventually became one of the most prominent icons of the Brazilian electronic scene, with honors and awards, such as; “Best DJ in Brazil” by the British magazine DJ Magazine in 2015, and being the only Brazilian in the top 25 in the world the following year. In 2017, he was elected by Forbes Brasil as one of the country’s 91 most influential people under 30 years . He is still the founder of the record label UP Club Records, a record label specializing in discovering new talents in electronic music and of Artist Factory, an artistic management company for musicians of the electronic scene – especially his record company, in partnership with Audiomix, Artists of the genre “sertanejo”.

body.plain:
DJ and Brazilian music producer of electronic music, Alok Achkar Peres Petrillo (pronounced /ˈalˈɔk/) is one of the most famous brazilian DJ’s/Artist. His parents were the precursors of psy trance in the country, creating one of the country’s most famous festivals, Universo Paralelo. He accompanied his parents' performances alongside his twin brother Bhaskar. With it, the duo released a totally authorial album by the independent label Vagalume Records and Liquid Records arriving to do shows in about 19 countries, in addition to their songs being featured in the Beatport virtual store.

In 2010, he decided to pursue a solo career, changing from genre to house music, which he calls Brazilian bass. Alok released some songs, becoming prominent in the market, being requested in several national and international festivals. After signing a contract with Dutch label Spinnin' Records, he released the song “Hear Me Now” featuring Bruno Martini with vocals and composition by Marcos Zeeba. The song achieved in just one month 10 million views on YouTube and consecrated Alok as the first Brazilian artist to get 100 million plays on the streaming platform Spotify and to reach the top 50 most played songs in the service. It was also certified as a platinum record in Italy by the Federazione Industria Musicale Italiana (FIMI), in addition to entering musical charts in several countries.

Petrillo eventually became one of the most prominent icons of the Brazilian electronic scene, with honors and awards, such as; “Best DJ in Brazil” by the British magazine DJ Magazine in 2015, and being the only Brazilian in the top 25 in the world the following year. In 2017, he was elected by Forbes Brasil as one of the country’s 91 most influential people under 30 years . He is still the founder of the record label UP Club Records, a record label specializing in discovering new talents in electronic music and of Artist Factory, an artistic management company for musicians of the electronic scene – especially his record company, in partnership with Audiomix, Artists of the genre “sertanejo”.

songs.lyrics:
3 ContributorsMe & You Lyrics[Verse 1: IRO]
Where have all the pictures gone
This place was home was before you left
All my hopes, all my dreams
Tried to move on but I just couldn't feel my feet
Let her fly, into the sky
The tears remain under my eyes
Haven't seen her since that day
If I could reach her now this is what I would say

[Chorus: IRO]
Wherever we go to
Whatever we do
It's only me, It's only you
Wherever we go to
Whatever we do
It's only me, It's only you

songs.lyrics:
10 ContributorsLove is a Temple Lyrics[Verse 1]
Goven me
Storm onto the light
I feel like life's design is a battlefield of mine
Marching on what do we worship for
I see the blood marks on my door
I run, we run, you cannot hide

[Chorus]
We are diamonds of nature
We are more than strangers
Fighting with eyes closed
We are lighting up the night
Ain't no star that shines so bright
And we're all aligned
Love is a temple
Love is a temple
Love is a temple
Love is a temple
Love is a temple
[Verse 2]
I run, we run, you cannot hide
Homesickness of waiting for that call
Will this be the day we fall?
Some the pray for sun to stop
Marching on
My brothers got my back
I can see some fading along the track
I fight, we fight, there is no end

[Chorus]
We are diamonds of nature
We are more than strangers
Fighting with eyes closed
We are lighting up the night
Ain't no star that shines so bright
And we're all aligned
Love is a temple
Love is a temple
Love is a temple
Love is a temple

songs.lyrics:
8 ContributorsTranslationsDeutschLove Again Lyrics[Verse 1]
When the sun goes up, when the sun goes down
It's been six days now with insomnia
Try to touch my skin, but I feel nothin'
I just think of you, don't know what to do
Clock is tickin' now and I hear the sound
Like an empty song playin' all day long
And I move my feet, but I feel no beat
I pretend to smile, but I cry inside

[Chorus]
Tell me, how will I, I, I ever learn, learn, learn
Learn to love, love, love, love again?
Tell me, how will I, I, I ever learn, learn, learn
Learn to love, love, love, love again?
[Verse 2]
When the sun goеs up, when the sun goes down

Try to make new friends, try to go outside
And I act okay, but it's not the same
